formattedAddress: 230 W 49th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 230 W 49th St, New York, NY 10019-7405, USA

originalText.text: I loved this show. As someone who watches South Park I could definitely see how it relates to the creators. I would definitely recommend this show for anyone that cant be easily offended cause it’s a different type of sense of humor. What a great show.

text.text: I loved this show. As someone who watches South Park I could definitely see how it relates to the creators. I would definitely recommend this show for anyone that cant be easily offended cause it’s a different type of sense of humor. What a great show.

originalText.text:
I went for the 2nd time and took out 13 year old to see this. Definitely not for those easily offended especially around religion. This show has very crude language.
It was hilarious and both my son and I were falling off our chairs laughing!

It was hilarious and both my son and I were falling off our chairs laughing!

originalText.text: I really really liked this musical, though I had a hard time understanding the actress who played Nabulungi (the village chief daughter) over the background music, which overpowered her in most scenes.

text.text: I really really liked this musical, though I had a hard time understanding the actress who played Nabulungi (the village chief daughter) over the background music, which overpowered her in most scenes.

originalText.text: This was one of the best shows I’ve seen on Broadway. Funny, really well choreographed, great music and production. Sat in the front row, though the theater was somewhat small and looked like you would have a good view regardless of where you sat.

text.text: This was one of the best shows I’ve seen on Broadway. Funny, really well choreographed, great music and production. Sat in the front row, though the theater was somewhat small and looked like you would have a good view regardless of where you sat.

originalText.text: So tasty Our reviews had over 36 million views this year. This our favorite play on Broadway right now.  Seen it 4 times in 2022 already.  Very funny.  The perfect musical with some really talented stars.  The songs, set, orchestra, actors and venue are perfect.  Still has the silly requirement of wearing a mask but if you keep a water bottle in your lap they do not really require you to wear a mask.  I had my mask off the entire time and no one cared.  Most of the folks in our area did not bother with masks either.  We have taken others from out of town, some religious, some not, but all of them have LOVED THIS PLAY.  2 thumbs way up.  Check out all of our reviews.  If we do not like it we do no review it so all of the ones you see are places that are fantastic.  Follow us if you like.  We had over 7 million views in 2021, over 13 million views in the first 6 months of 2022 and we thank you for that.  We don't get paid, we just love to eat.  Be sure to click on "RobH" at the top of this review to see all of them and to follow us if you like good food and FUN.
